name: MariaDB
description: The fastest growing Open Source Database

projects.project_name: MariaDB Support in ann-benchmarks and VectorDBBench
projects.summary: Add support for MariaDB in benchmarking tools like ann-benchmarks and VectorDBBench.
Implement support for flexible data loading through plugins, enhancing the existing loading capabilities for MariaDB.

projects.project_name: Generate Vector Embeddings Automatically on INSERT
projects.summary: Create an API for generating document embeddings during inserts, simplifying the vector processing pipeline.
Extend the mysqltest framework to support standard arithmetic and comparison operations.
Enhance mysqltest language to allow bash-like variable substitutions and recursive expansions.

projects.project_name: Create Utility to Parse frm Files and Print Their DDL
projects.summary: Develop a utility to read FRM files and generate corresponding DDL statements for easier database administration.
Develop a dashboard for statistics from Buildbot builds to monitor build health and performance.

jina_response:
Title: Google Summer of Code 2025

URL Source: https://mariadb.com/kb/en/google-summer-of-code-2025/

Markdown Content:
This year we are again participating in the [Google Summer of Code](https://summerofcode.withgoogle.com/). We, joined with the [MariaDB Foundation](https://www.mariadb.org/), believe we are making a better database that remains application compatible with MySQL. We also work on making LGPL connectors (currently [C](https://mariadb.com/kb/en/mariadb-connector-c/), [C++](https://mariadb.com/kb/en/google-summer-of-code-2025/mariadb-connector-c%2B%2B), [ODBC](https://mariadb.com/kb/en/mariadb-connector-odbc/), [Java](https://mariadb.com/kb/en/mariadb-connector-j/), [Node.js](https://mariadb.com/kb/en/nodejs-connector/)) and on [MariaDB Galera Cluster](https://mariadb.com/kb/en/galera/), which allows you to scale your reads & writes. And we have [MariaDB ColumnStore](https://mariadb.com/kb/en/mariadb-columnstore/), which is a columnar storage engine, designed to process petabytes of data with real-time response to analytical queries.

### Contents

1.  [Where to Start](https://mariadb.com/kb/en/google-summer-of-code-2025/#where-to-start "Where to Start")
2.  [List of Tasks](https://mariadb.com/kb/en/google-summer-of-code-2025/#list-of-tasks "List of Tasks")
    1.  [MariaDB Server](https://mariadb.com/kb/en/google-summer-of-code-2025/#mariadb-server "MariaDB Server")
        1.  [MDEV-35997 MariaDB support in ann-benchmarks and VectorDBBench](https://mariadb.com/kb/en/google-summer-of-code-2025/#mdev-35997-mariadb-support-in-ann-benchmarks-and-vectordbbench "MDEV-35997 MariaDB support in ann-benchmarks and VectorDBBench")
        2.  [MDEV-28395 LOAD DATA plugins](https://mariadb.com/kb/en/google-summer-of-code-2025/#mdev-28395-load-data-plugins "MDEV-28395 LOAD DATA plugins")
        3.  [MDEV-36100 Generate vector embeddings automatically on INSERT](https://mariadb.com/kb/en/google-summer-of-code-2025/#mdev-36100-generate-vector-embeddings-automatically-on-insert "MDEV-36100 Generate vector embeddings automatically on INSERT")
        4.  [MDEV-36107 expressions in mysqltest](https://mariadb.com/kb/en/google-summer-of-code-2025/#mdev-36107-expressions-in-mysqltest "MDEV-36107 expressions in mysqltest")
        5.  [MDEV-36108 variable substitutions in mysqltest](https://mariadb.com/kb/en/google-summer-of-code-2025/#mdev-36108-variable-substitutions-in-mysqltest "MDEV-36108 variable substitutions in mysqltest")
        6.  [MDEV-18827 Create utility to parse frm files and print their DDL](https://mariadb.com/kb/en/google-summer-of-code-2025/#mdev-18827-create-utility-to-parse-frm-files-and-print-their-ddl "MDEV-18827 Create utility to parse frm files and print their DDL")
        7.  [Buildbot build statistics dashboard](https://mariadb.com/kb/en/google-summer-of-code-2025/#buildbot-build-statistics-dashboard "Buildbot build statistics dashboard")
3.  [Suggest a Task](https://mariadb.com/kb/en/google-summer-of-code-2025/#suggest-a-task "Suggest a Task")

Where to Start
--------------

Please join us on [Zulip](https://mariadb.com/kb/en/irc-chat-servers-and-zulip-instance/) to mingle with the community. You should also subscribe to the [developers mailing list](https://lists.mariadb.org/postorius/lists/developers.lists.mariadb.org) (this is the main list where we discuss development - there are also [other mailing lists](https://mariadb.com/kb/en/mailing-lists/)).

To improve your chances of being accepted, it is a good idea to submit a pull request with a bug fix to the server.

Also see the [List of beginner friendly issues](https://jira.mariadb.org/issues/?jql=status%20%3D%20Open%20AND%20resolution%20%3D%20Unresolved%20AND%20labels%20%3D%20beginner-friendly%20ORDER%20BY%20updated%20DESC) from the MariaDB Issue Tracker.

List of Tasks
-------------

MariaDB Server
--------------

* * *

### [MDEV-35997](https://jira.mariadb.org/browse/MDEV-35997) MariaDB support in ann-benchmarks and VectorDBBench

**Part-time project 175h**

Add MariaDB support to [ann-benchmarks](https://github.com/erikbern/ann-benchmarks) and [VectorDBBench](https://github.com/zilliztech/VectorDBBench).

**Skills needed:** Python, Docker  
**Mentors:** Vicențiu Ciorbaru

* * *

### [MDEV-28395](https://jira.mariadb.org/browse/MDEV-28395) LOAD DATA plugins

**Full-time project 350h**

`LOAD DATA INFILE` can flexibly load data into a table from CSV-like files accessible by the mariadbdb process. `LOAD XML INFILE` can do it for XML files. `LOAD DATA LOCAL INFILE` and `LOAD XML LOCAL INFILE` can do it with files accessible by the client, but not by the server. But there are requests to suport loading more file formats and from other locations, for example, from S3.

This project is to implement support for LOAD plugins and refactor the current LOAD code accordingly. There are two kind of plugins — data parser plugin (CSV-like and XML) and transfer plugin (file and LOCAL). Implementing new plugins is not in the scope of this task, this task is mainly about moving existing code around, creating a _possibility_ for new plugins (like JSON or S3).

**Skills needed:** C++, bison  
**Mentors:** Sergei Golubchik

* * *

### [MDEV-36100](https://jira.mariadb.org/browse/MDEV-36100) Generate vector embeddings automatically on INSERT

**Full-time project 350h**

Implement a syntax and a plugin API that the server will use to generate embeddings for documents that the user stores in the database. This should allow to simplify significantly the vector pipeline. mariadbd will not generate embeddings internally, it will invoke a plugin to do that.

**Skills needed:** C++  
**Mentors:** Sergei Golubchik

* * *

### [MDEV-36107](https://jira.mariadb.org/browse/MDEV-36107) expressions in mysqltest

**Part-time project 175h**

extend mysqltest language to support

*   standard arithmetic `+`, `-`, `*`, `/`, `%`
*   comparisons `==`, `!=`, `<`, `<=`, `>`, `>=`
*   boolean `&&`, `||`, may be `? :`
*   if possible: string repetition, perl-style `x` (to replace `SELECT REPEAT()` in test files)

This should work in commands `let`, `if`, `while`

**Skills needed:** C++  
**Mentors:** Sergei Golubchik

* * *

### [MDEV-36108](https://jira.mariadb.org/browse/MDEV-36108) variable substitutions in mysqltest

**Part-time project 175h**

extend mysqltest language to support bash-like substitutions:

*   `${var}`
*   `${parameter:offset:length}`
*   `${#parameter}`
*   `${parameter/pattern/string/flags}`
*   may be `${parameterˆ}`, `${parameterˆˆ}`, `${parameter,}`, `${parameter}`
*   may be `${parameter@function}` with functions like `u`, `U`, `Q`, etc

recursive expansion:

*   `${${var}}`

**Skills needed:** C++  
**Mentors:** Sergei Golubchik

* * *

### [MDEV-18827](https://jira.mariadb.org/browse/MDEV-18827) Create utility to parse frm files and print their DDL

**Full-time project - potential part-time (175 - 350h, depending on scope)**

FRM files are what MariaDB uses to store metadata about tables. These files can be used to generate DDL statements (CREATE TABLE ...). We are lacking a utility to parse these files which could in turn make DBAs lives easier. The task of this project is to have this utility implemented, making use of MariaDB's FRM parsing logic. You may have to carry out some refactoring to extract the parsing code into a reusable library, once for MariaDB Server, once for the FRM parsing tool.

**Skills needed:** C/C++, understanding libraries and APIs.  
**Mentors:** Vicențiu Ciorbaru / Sergei Golubchik

* * *

### Buildbot build statistics dashboard

**Part-time project 175h** TODO - A more ample description will be created.

**Skills needed:**  
**Mentors:** Vlad Radu

* * *

Suggest a Task
--------------

Do you have an idea of your own, not listed above? Do let us know in the comments below (Click 'Login' on the top of the page first)!
